reviewText:
Highschool project adventure/visual novel.

The page says the game needs 200 MB HD space, but it downloads 18 MB, and a third of that is the XNA framework. So, actual game ~12 MB. The graphics resolution is 720p, quality ranges from bad Flash drawings to beaten-to-death-with-effects photographs. There are 18 backgrounds and 16 characters, but you'll only get to see about half of these because the game crashes as soon as you sell something to the baker. The voiceovers have amateur quality as well. I am calling this a visual novel because you can't really manipulate items in the environment; most of the gameplay is cutscenes and dialogue (but you do get a movable avatar in three scenes, animation is 4 frames).
One positive point: I can confirm that it will run (such as it can, seeing it crashes in the baker scene) on an old slow XP box.

It's a very incomplete amateur game. Don't pay money for this.

reviewText: Let me walk u through the game. Ur dad kicks u out got not making a butterfly game. u meet a guy named adickle he gives u 10 dollars. use 10 dollars to buy food for baker. sell food to baker and crash game 40 times before you figure out trick.  that is u have to exit the baker fast before crash. get robbed of money u made trade your clothes to a hobo for his. With new clothes drug dealer will sell you drugs. get pie from baker . take pie and drugs to food place wher ex racer food guy will make drug pie. take drug pie to baker get 4000 bux. get another pie from baker becuase the game doesnt realize u already did the invent pie quest and will let u repeat it ad infinium. That is all ive been able to do i made like 60 thousand selling pies to the baker but nothing else happens. and i also talked to the guy up the elevator. so ya this game is poop

reviewText:
I got this game in a bundle before, so I was not as irritated as some people who paid full price.

It has a number of bugs in it - one causes the game to crash. It is pretty short (under 10 minutes), art is okay, the whole thing is kind of something you would have seen on Newgrounds before.
The best part of the game was the business dude conversations which ended up making me laugh.

I don't recommend buying it, instead just go watch the 5 min let's play of it.

reviewText: If this is supposed to be the remastered version of an older game, then why is it so insufferably tedious to play? Everything screams rush job here. Some things are intentionally badly done (graphics notably), which is fine by me, but the UI is horrendous, some of the voice acting is painfully delivered through a faulty microphone, there's a crash at the baker shop (I managed to circumvent it by selling for $5 and then immediately leaving the shop), there is no save feature (all right, you can finish the game in less than 10 minutes but when you have to re-do it several times to get past that crash, it gets annoying), the inventory is ridiculous, and worst of all, you have to move with the arrow keys and bring up the inventory with the 'i' key, while the rest is done with the mouse... Sorry? You couldn't spend five minutes adding arrow icons to the left and right borders of the screen, and an Inventory icon in a corner?\n\nI liked Tokyo Hosto and even recommended it, and I had a few laugh at the silly conversations in here too. But at this point, it's just a ridiculous scam attempt, a project that was destined from the start to be bundled so the guy could make a few easy bucks and not have to worry about people asking for refunds. This would be enough to make you lose faith in the indie scene...
